product.description: The Nazis murdered their husbands but concentration cam risoners Priska, Rachel, and Anka would not let evil take their unborn children too#8212;a remarkable true story that will aeal to readers of emThe Lostem and emThe Nazi Officer#8217;s Wife, Born Survivorsem celebrates three mothers who defied death to give their children life.Eastern Euroe, 1944: Three women believe they are regnant, but are torn from their husbands before they can be certain. Rachel is sent to Auschwitz, unaware that her husband has been shot. Priska and her husband travel there together, but are immediately searated. Also at Auschwitz, Anka hoes in vain to be reunited with her husband. With the rest of their families gassed, these young wives are determined to hold on to all they have left#8212;their lives, and those of their unborn babies. Having concealed their condition from infamous Nazi doctor Josef Mengele, they are forced to work and almost starved to death, living in daily fear of their regnancies being detected by the SS.In Aril 1945, as the Allies close in, Priska gives birth. She and her baby, along with Anka, Rachel, and the remaining inmates, are sent to Mauthausen concentration cam on a hellish seventeen-day train journey. Rachel gives birth on the train, and Anka at the cam gates. All believe they will die, but then a miracle occurs. The gas chamber runs out of Zyklon-B, and as the Allied troos near, the SS flee. Against all odds, the three mothers and their newborns survive their treacherous journey to freedom.On the seventieth anniversary of Mauthausen#8217;s liberation from the Nazis by American soldiers, renowned biograher Wendy Holden recounts this extraordinary story of three children united by their mothers#8217; unbelievable#8212;yet ultimately successful#8212;fight for survival.

product.name: Calypso
product.description: If you've ever laughed your way through David Sedaris's cheerfully misanthroic stories, you might think you know what you're getting with Calyso. You'd be wrong. When he buys a beach house on the Carolina coast, Sedaris envisions long, relaxing vacations sent laying board games and lounging in the sun with those he loves most. And life at the Sea Section, as he names the vacation home, is exactly as idyllic as he imagined, excet for one tiny, vexing realization: it's imossible to take a vacation from yourself. With Calyso, Sedaris sets his formidable owers of observation toward middle age and mortality. Make no mistake: these stories are very, very funny - it's a book that can make you laugh 'til you snort, the way only family can. Sedaris's writing has never been sharer, and his ability to shock readers into laughter unaralleled. But much of the comedy here is born out of that vertiginous moment when your own body betrays you and you realize that the story of your life is made u of more ast than future. This is beach reading for eole who detest beaches, required reading for those who loathe small talk and love a good tumour joke. Calyso is simultaneously Sedaris's darkest and warmest book yet - and it just might be his very best.

product.name: How to Change Your Mind: What the New Science of Psychedelics Teaches Us About Consciousness, Dying, Addiction, Depression, and Transcendence (Random House Large Print)
product.description: bbA brilliant and brave investigation by Michael Pollan, author of five bbiNew York Timesibb best sellers, into the medical and scientific revolution taking lace around sychedelic drugs--and the sellbinding story of his own life-changing sychedelic exeriences bb When Michael Pollan set out to research how LSD and silocybin (the active ingredient in magic mushrooms) are being used to rovide relief to eole suffering from difficult-to-treat conditions such as deression, addiction and anxiety, he did not intend to write what is undoubtedly his most ersonal book. But uon discovering how these remarkable substances are imroving the lives not only of the mentally ill but also of healthy eole coming to gris with the challenges of everyday life, he decided to exlore the landscae of the mind in the first erson as well as the third. Thus began a singular adventure into the exerience of various altered states of consciousness, along with a e dee into both the latest brain science and the thriving underground community of sychedelic theraists. Pollan sifts the historical record to searate the truth about these mysterious drugs from the myths that have surrounded them since the Sixties, when a handful of sychedelic evangelists catalyzed a owerful backlash against what was then a romising field of research. A unique and elegant blend of science, memoir, travel writing, history, and medicine, iHow to Change Your Mindi is a triumh of articiatory journalism. By turns dazzling and edifying, it is the griing account of a journey to an exciting and unexected new frontier in our understanding of the mind, the self, and our lace in the world. The true subject of Pollan's "mental travelogue" is not just sychedelic drugs, but the eternal uzzle of human consciousness and how, in a world that offers us both struggle and beauty, we can do our best to be fully resent and find meaning in our lives.

product.name: Data Point Unavailable for Product
product.description: bbInstant#160;iNew York Timesi#160;Bestsellerbr br Legendary venture caitalist John Doerr reveals how the goal-setting system of Objectives and Key Results (OKRs) has heled tech giants from Intel to Google achieve exlosive growthmdash;and how it can hel any organization thrive. bbbr br In the fall of 1999, John Doerr met with the founders of a start-u whom he'd just given $12.5 million, the biggest investment of his career. He had first discovered OKRs in the 1970s as an engineer at Intel, where the legendary Andy Grove (#x22;the greatest manager of his or any era#x22;) drove the best-run comany Doerr had ever seen. Everyone's goals, from entry level to CEO, are transarent to the entire organization. br br The benefits are rofound. OKRs surface an organization's most imortant work.
